Module count
Package count.io

Class NewickParser

java.lang.Object
count.io.NewickParser
public class NewickParser
extends Object
Newick-format phylogeny parsing. Implementing classes fill exploit the hooks startChildren(), nextChild(), endChildren() and endTree(), setLength(double) and setName(java.lang.String), which are called by readTree(). The grammar used here is the following. [Corresponds to the Newick format used by Phylip, DRAWTREE etc., with the addition of the '#' style comments, see Joe Felsenstein;s specification]. The original specification allowed internal taxon names only after the subtree, here we accept the name also before. Terminals:
  • SEMICOLON ;
  • LPAREN (
  • RPAREN )
  • COMMA ,
  • COLON :
  • SEMICOLON ;
  • LBRACKET [
  • RBRACKET ]
  • QUOTE '
  • DBLQUOTE "
  • NUMBER IEEE floating point value (Inf, -Inf, NaN are ok)
  • ALPHANUM
Grammar: 
        <Tree>           ::= <Node> SEMICOLON
        <Node>           ::= <Leaf>|<Internal>
        <Internal>       ::= <Name> LPAREN <Nodelist> RPAREN <Edge length>
                                                | LPAREN <NodeList> RPAREN <Edge Length>
                                                | LPAREN <NodeList> RPAREN <Name> <Edge Length>
        <Leaf>           ::= <Name> <Edge length>|<Edge length>
        <Nodelist>       ::= <Node>|(<Node> COMMA <Nodelist>)
        <Edge length>    ::= |<Nonzero edge>
        <Nonzero edge>   ::= COLON NUMBER
        <Name>           ::= <quoted or unquoted name>
Whitespaces (newline, tab, space) are allowed anywhere between tokens. Remarks are allowed where whitespace is allowed, they either start with '#' and continue until the end of line or are enclosed in brackets.
Since:
2001
Author:
Miklós Csűrös

      hashmark_comments_allowed - whether # can start a comment
      relaxed_name_parsing - whether unescaped single quotes are ok in the name

    • printTree

      public static String printTree​(Phylogeny tree, boolean always_quote_name, boolean show_edge_lengths, boolean line_breaks_after_each_node, boolean show_node_identifiers)
      Newick-formatted String for a phylogeny.
      Parameters:
      tree - (possibly empty, with null root)
      always_quote_name - whether single quotes are placed around node names alwats, or only when necessary
      show_edge_lengths - whether edge lengths should be printed
      line_breaks_after_each_node - whether each node should be in a new line (or, rather, return a one-line string)
      show_node_identifiers - whether the output should include then node indexes (in comments)
      Returns:
      a properly formatted String by the specification

    • printTree

      private static StringBuilder printTree​(StringBuilder sb, Phylogeny.Node node, boolean always_quote_name, boolean show_edge_lengths, boolean line_breaks_after_each_node, String[] node_comments)
      The recursive printing procedure for printing the subtree (without closing semicolon).
      Parameters:
      sb - may be null
      node - root of subtree
      always_quote_name -
      show_edge_lengths -
      line_breaks_after_each_node -
      node_comments -
      Returns:
      sb appended with printing of this subtree

    • formatName

      public static String formatName​(String name, boolean always_quote)
      Inserts quotes into/around a string following Newick specification. Quotes are added if a taxon name contains a lexical token (parentheses, brackets, quotes) or white space. Single quote in the name ("baker's yeast") are encoded by doubling the single quote: 'baker''s yeast'.
      Parameters:
      name - taxon name (null is OK, empty String "" will be returned)
      always_quote - whether forcing quotes in the returned name (or only if necessary)
      Returns:
      properly formatted string to write in Newick file as node name.

    • toIEEEFormat

      public static String toIEEEFormat​(double d)
      A compact display format including extended numerical values.
      Parameters:
      d - the value that needs to be displayed
      Returns:
      a formatted string with default precision

    • toIEEEFormat

      public static String toIEEEFormat​(double d, int decimals, double too_short)
      A compact display format for extended numerical values. NaN, positive and negative infinity are recognized. The value is shown with a precision defined by the number of decimal digits wanted after the decimal point. Very short edge lengths are replaced with a fixed, tiny positive.
      Parameters:
      d - value to be displayed
      decimals - preferred precision for large values
      too_short - length cutoff for very short edges
      Returns:
      short character string for edge length display and I/O

      IOException

    • readTree

      public Phylogeny readTree() throws NewickParser.ParseException, IOException
      Lexical parsing for Newick format. The codeuses the hooks startChildren(), nextChild(), endChildren() and endTree(), setLength(double) and setName(java.lang.String) for actions in different parsing states.
      Returns:
      the parsed phylogeny (until the next semicolon in the input)
      Throws:
      NewickParser.ParseException - if input format does not conform
      IOException - if I/O problem with file (reading or access)

    • startChildren

      protected void startChildren()
      Called by readTree() when starting to visit the current node's children (opening parenthesis).

      protected void nextChild()

    • endChildren

      protected void endChildren()

      Throws:

    • endTree

      protected void endTree()

    • skipBlanksAndComments

      private int skipBlanksAndComments() throws IOException
      Skips white space and comments in the input. Reading position advances to the next informative character.
      Returns:
      first non-comment, non-whitespace character
      Throws:
      IOException - if reading fails

    • resetBuffer

      private void resetBuffer()

    • checkBuffer

      Adds one character in the buffer; extended if necessary.
      Parameters:
      c - character to be added at the end

    • parseEdgeLength

      private double parseEdgeLength() throws IOException, NewickParser.ParseException
      Parses edge length. In addition to usual numerical values, accept NaN, +Inf, -Inf and Inf.
      Returns:
      edge length; maybe NaN, positive or negative infinity
      Throws:
      IOException
      NewickParser.ParseException

    • parseName

      private String parseName() throws IOException
      Reads in a taxon name according to Newick rules. If relaxed name parsing is allowed (relaxed_name_parsing), then unescaped single quotes are accepted (e.g., Brewer's yeast).
      Returns:
      a String containing the taxon name
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is a problem while reading

    • mainmain

      private void mainmain​(String[] args) throws Exception
      Throws:
      Exception

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args) throws Exception
      Main entry for testing.
      Parameters:
      args - 1 or 2 arguments: file and comma-separated list of terminal taxa
      Throws:
      Exception - whenever it feels like it
